intro: Trimeris oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trimeris, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Trimeris oblongifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
